title: Songs to Fill the Air: Tales of the Grateful Dead
features: Songs to Fill the Air: Tales of the Grateful Dead
Aces Back to Back: The History of the Grateful Dead

s a collection of essays on the Grateful Dead: never-before-told tales that reach across far-ranging, and fascinating, topics and individuals. There are essays on Tom Constanten, Donna Godchaux, Brent's family, Robert Hunter, John Barlow and compositions on Dead & Company, the Fare Thee Well concerts, Brent, Pigpen, Donna, Bobby, John Mayer, and Ken Kesey.

is beautifully illustrated by Hannah Hopkins, a Miami Beach artist who created ten amazing drawings that perfectly accompany the text. Important players in the Grateful Dead's history, never before given their due, come to life on the pages of this new and exciting tome: luthiers Travis Bean and Stephen Cripe; Hells Angel Chocolate George; Sue Stephen (Jerry's long-time bookkeeper and close friend); Merry Prankster and Mime Troupe member Joe McCord; singer Edie Brickell; band technician Bob Bralove; race car driver Leilani Maaja Münter (Bobby's sister-in-law); NBA coach Luke Walton, and photographer Linda Eastman McCartney !And a few new players are introduced as well -- musician John Mayer, baseball all-star Jake Peavy, football team owner Jim Irsay, Sonja Dada band member Dan Pritzker and Brent's daughter, Jennifer Mydland !Important concerts in Grateful Dead lore are analyzed: December 4, 1965 in San Jose; February 14, 1968 at the Carousel; May 6, 1970 at MIT; May 8, 1977 at Cornell; March 30, 1980 at the Cap in New Jersey; September 24, 1988 at MSG; October 8 and 9, 1989 in Hampton, and June 21,1995 in Albany.There are two different essays that connect the Grateful Dead's history to the Beatles' history, and others connecting Dead lore to David Bowie, Pink Floyd and rapper Tupac Shakur.Additionally discussed: the relevance of films such as

to the Dead's tale.There are also compositions on the Grateful Dead song "Jack Straw" and songs such as "Morning Dew," Steely Dan's "Kid Charlemagne," Brewer and Shipley's "One Toke Over the Line" and Graham Nash's "I Used to Be a King."The story, and inspiration, behind Weir's late-career masterpiece,

, is revealed.Mr. Allen has included a number of tales about his on-the-road experiences hitchhiking and traveling to see the Dead -- everywhere from San Francisco to Philadelphia, from Texas to Manhattan !The Fare Thee Well concerts in the summer of 2015 are covered, as is the entire  history of Dead & Company.The last four years of Garcia's life (1992-95) are detailed, with a focus on his attempt to start a new band in 1993 and his repeated attempts in 1994 and 1995 to leave the Grateful Dead.
Songs to Fill the Air: Tales of the Grateful Dead
is an engaging read that completes the story, and history, of the Dead in an informative and compelling manner.
description: Review

Five stars !."Scott intuitively understood at the time the music was being made the historical, sociological and aesthetic importance of the Band and its scene that are still going strong 52 years after they first played as a group in a local Pizza joint.
Songs to Fill the Air

is a pleasure to read and is filled with funny and interesting stories, anecdotes, first hand accounts, and sometimes profound observations.".- Robert Pistella,DeadheadFreehold, NJDecember 13, 2017Five stars here !."Scott has taken the best tales, assembled the names, the dates, the places and characters involved and put together this little book. What this book most reminds me of is being in a conversation with another fan of the Dead and this other fan of the Dead actually can remember the dates and places where some pretty intense stuff happened. It's a tale of a time gone by ... a happening that will never happen again ... a band that existed for the music, for the fans and for the good of the universe.".- Amazon customer and DeadheadJanuary 13, 2018
From the Author

I am thrilled to be able to continue bringing my writing on the Grateful Dead to you and the world. First and foremost, I acknowledge, and truly appreciate, the help, support and love of the Deadhead community.Thank you, all.- Scott November, 2017
From the Inside Flap
"Without love in the dream it will never come true."- Robert Hunter
From the Back Cover
Author Scott W. Allen wrote for
Relix

magazine from 1983 until 1992, serving as a Senior Writer, columnist ("Fragments"), and feature article writer. In 1989 and 1990, he championed the cause of bringing to justice the murderers of Deadhead Adam Katz. Mr. Allen's articles and essays on the Grateful Dead have also been published on the Library of Congress website and his work in
Relix
is archived in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame + Museum..Scott was blessed to attend 236 concerts by the Grateful Dead and his only regret is not seeing them more often.
About the Author
Songs to Fill the Air: Tales of the Grateful Dead
is my follow-up to
Aces Back to Back: The History of the Grateful Dead
. If you've enjoyed my writing style in
AB2B
and on my Facebook page, you will love my new book !
